required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evolution of Perceived Stress in General Practice Residents During COVID-19 Sanitary Crisis
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Evolution of Perceived Stress in General Practice Residents of Rouen and Caen During COVID-19 Sanitary Crisis

brief_summary.textblock: Over the last several years, distress among healthcare professionnals is well described, and general practice residents are also affected. Because of COVID-19 sanitary crisis, stress factors are increased, and that may cause anxiety, exhaustion, psychic distress, depression, addictions, or post traumatic stress.

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective non-interventional study aims to evaluate via two questionnaires the evolution of perceived stress in general practice residents of two centres in France, Rouen and Caen. The two questionnaires contain the Perceived Stress Scale, as well as items regarding socio-demographic data and stress factors. The first questionnaire is to be distributed during the epidemic COVID-19 wave and the second questionnaire at the end of the epidemic COVID-19 wave.

primary_outcome.measure: Evolution of perceived stress during the epidemic wave of COVID19 vs. at the end of the epidemic wave of COVID19
primary_outcome.time_frame: maximum 6 months, according to the evolution of the epidemic
primary_outcome.description: The perceived stress will be evaluated using the Perceived Stress Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of general characteristics of residents and their feelings and experiences with the sanitary crisis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: maximum 6 months, according to the evolution of the epidemic
secondary_outcome.description: This include socio-demographic characteristics, work-related information and potential stress factors

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of residents' profile stress according to their socio-demographic and working characteristics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: maximum 6 months, according to the evolution of the epidemic
secondary_outcome.description: Identification of stress factors among residents

study_pop.textblock: Participants being general practice residents in Caen or Rouen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being a general practice resident in Rouen or Caen
- Participant informed and non-objection of him/her
Exclusion Criteria:
- Being on maternity leave or not working during the period concerned with the questionnaires
